metadata.header_path: /FORM 10-K/Part II/Item 8 - Financial Statements and Supplementary Data/NOTES TO CONSOLIDATED FINANCIAL STATEMENTS/Note 7 â€” COMMITMENTS AND CONTINGENCIES/
aws::graph::propositions: Legal Actions Against Amazon
The Attorney General of Arizona filed a complaint in the Superior Court of Arizona in Maricopa County in May 2024.
The Arizona Attorney General's complaint alleges Amazon's practices related to pricing violate state antitrust laws.
The Arizona Attorney General's complaint alleges Amazon's practices related to the Featured Offers in its stores violate state antitrust laws.
The Arizona Attorney General's complaint alleges Amazon's practices related to pricing violate state consumer protection laws.
The Arizona Attorney General's complaint alleges Amazon's practices related to the Featured Offers in its stores violate state consumer protection laws.
The Arizona Attorney General's complaint seeks injunctive relief.
The Arizona Attorney General's complaint seeks an unspecified amount of damages.
The Arizona Attorney General's complaint seeks civil penalties.
The Arizona Attorney General's complaint seeks costs.
Amazon's motion to dismiss in Frame-Wilson was granted in part in March 2022.
Amazon's motion to dismiss in Frame-Wilson was denied in part in March 2022.
Amazon's motion to dismiss in Frame-Wilson was granted in part in March 2023.
Amazon's motion to dismiss in Frame-Wilson was denied in part in March 2023.
Amazon's motion to dismiss in De Coster v. Amazon.com, Inc. (W.D. Wash.) was granted in part in January 2023.
Amazon's motion to dismiss in De Coster v. Amazon.com, Inc. (W.D. Wash.) was denied in part in January 2023.
Amazon's motion to dismiss in the California Attorney General's lawsuit was granted in part in March 2023.
Amazon's motion to dismiss in the California Attorney General's lawsuit was denied in part in March 2023.
The complaint referenced at the beginning seeks injunctive relief.
The complaint referenced at the beginning seeks structural relief.
The complaint referenced at the beginning seeks an unspecified amount of damages.
The complaint referenced at the beginning seeks costs.

text: The complaint seeks injunctive and structural relief, an unspecified amount of damages, and costs. In May 2024, the Attorney General of Arizona filed a complaint in the Superior Court of Arizona in Maricopa County alleging that Amazonâ€™s practices related to pricing and the Featured Offers in its stores violate state antitrust and consumer protection laws. That complaint also seeks injunctive relief, an unspecified amount of damages, civil penalties, and costs. Amazonâ€™s motions to dismiss were granted in part and denied in part in Frame-Wilson in March 2022 and March 2023, De Coster v. Amazon.com, Inc. (W.D. Wash.) in January 2023, and the California Attorney Generalâ€™s lawsuit in March 2023.
